column4: hello i installed proftpd and i was wondering i tryed to add a user by typeing this sudo useradd userftp -p mypassword -d /var/www/ -s /bin/false and it didnt not work how would i add a ftp user for directory /var/www/
/var/www is readable by any user
was that command right i used?
^ sorry
well they will not be able to do it without a password
good, well, you have privileges for that user to write to the directory? did the command error out? did you read man useradd?
ftp localhost?
well all this is hosted from my old pc
can you ping the computer? do you get asked for a user name and password?
and? when you ftp to it, do you get asked for user name and password?
yes
can you log in with any other user?
sudo invoke-rc.d proftps restart
i tryed restarting it many times
try ftping from the machine itself, to itself. do you have a router?
yeah i got a router
i also tryed this cant even access ftp from the machine
I did not catch, do you get asked for a user name and password?
yes
try vsftpd.
ok is there a guide to set that up ?
ya: "sudo aptitude install vsftpd"
